|footnotes = }} 'CerkovinÃ«' is a village in Albania, part of the NovoselÃ«
municipality, in the District of VlorÃ«.

It is located 12 km away from VlorÃ« city (north direction) and 8 km
away from the Adriatic seashore. It is a settlement since the 7th century AD (or
even older).

CerkovinÃ« in Bulgarian language means "Place of Churches". So the village's
name obviously comes from the Bulgarian invasion during the expansion of the
First Bulgarian Empire in the 10th century. There is a place named "The Church"
but there is no church at all, nor ruins. CerkovinÃ«'s territory is mainly
composed of hills full of hundreds of years old olive trees and vineyards. The
major products of CerkovinÃ« are grapes and olives. The hills in front of the
sea and a typical Mediterranean climate make CerkovinÃ« a perfect place for
vineyards and olives. In CerkovinÃ« there is the only salt factory in Albania
which has occupied a huge field from the CerkovinÃ«'s territory between the
village and the seashore.
